message.content:
A digital clock is an electronic device that displays the time using numerical digits rather than traditional clock hands. 
It typically consists of a rectangular or circular screen with black digits on a white background. 
The digits are usually bright and prominently displayed for easy visibility from a distance. 
Digital clocks can be found in a variety of settings, such as homes, offices, schools, and public areas. 
Their accuracy and ease of use make them a popular choice for timekeeping. 
Some digital clocks also include additional features such as alarm functionality or the ability to display the date. 
Overall, digital clocks are a ubiquitous and utilitarian device used to keep track of time in a modern, electronic age.
